channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Why Did My Husband Die?: Unsealing The Secrets Of Radiation Exposure
channel.desc: Japanese people were exposed to nuclear radiation in the bombings at the end of World War Two, and US nuclear tests at Bikini Atoll. But the facts about another exposure are only now being revealed.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: The World Heritage Sites In Japan
channel.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Grand Sumo Live
channel.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN will broadcast GRAND SUMO July Tournament Day 15 action live from Nagoya, as top wrestlers have their fifteenth bouts of the 15-day contest.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Anime Manga Explosion
channel.desc: ANIME MANGA EXPLOSION features major Japanese anime and manga works that are highly recognized by international fans. Each episode explores the secrets of the works' popularity.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Take Tech
channel.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Tiny Desk Concerts Japan
channel.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Japanology Plus Mini
channel.desc: Japan has 9 million vacant homes. We investigate the issue of vacant homes in Japan and see how they're being used creatively to promote population growth and regional revitalization.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Core Kyoto Mini
channel.desc: Discover the unique, traditional method of roof thatching that uses Hinoki cypress bark.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Zero Waste Life
channel.desc: Fish that overconsume seaweed, often called pests. A strong odor also makes them hard to sell. Kanazawa Ryuji uses these to make a distinctive fish sauce, so that no life from the sea goes to waste.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Why Did My Husband Die?: Unsealing The Secrets Of Radiation Exposure
channel.desc: Japanese people were exposed to nuclear radiation in the bombings at the end of World War Two, and US nuclear tests at Bikini Atoll. But the facts about another exposure are only now being revealed.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Searching For The Standing Boy Of Nagasaki
channel.desc: Who is the boy who waits stoically to cremate his dead brother in Nagasaki? The search for his identity continues, as the iconic image has come to symbolize the fate of "atomic-bomb orphans.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Kaizoku: Noshima Island
channel.desc: The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea. We explore their history and legacy, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time, Noshima Island.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: Nakahara Sachiko translates the looks of popular Japanese anime and manga characters into costumes for live-action adaptations. She talks about making an impact on the global stage.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
channel.desc: Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Easy Japanese
channel.desc: #44 I've heard he's giving another recital. / To tell someone what you heard from someone else, use adjectives or verbs without "masu" or "desu," then add "soo desu.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Hello! Nhk World Japan
channel.desc: August marks 80 years since WW2's end. NHK will run a special feature on Hiroshima & Nagasaki, with programs about war and peace, and a website called "The Pursuit of PEACE: Searching for Answers.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Seasoning The Seasons
channel.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
channel.desc: Kir's life reads like a novel: low-ranking male macaque shunned by the ladies and bullied by those around him gets a new chance in a neighboring troop. Does a reversal of fortune lie on the horizon.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk News 7
channel.desc: News 7 is NHK's flagship domestic evening news program, bringing you the latest from our Tokyo studio. It's presented with English audio on NHK World for our international viewers.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Newsroom Tokyo
channel.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: One In Every Japanese
channel.desc: 1 in 1000 Japanese have experience as a lay judge in court cases. We witness a networking event for former lay judges, where they discuss unique experiences. What does it feel like to judge others.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Ukiyoe Edo Life: The Piercing Gaze
channel.desc: A man strikes a pose in an iconic woodblock print by the artist Sharaku. Who is the mysterious figure... and what is he doing? And why did the artist want to commemorate the moment.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Magical Japanese
channel.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to horses. Explore the unique culture behind them.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Culture Crossroads
channel.desc: Culture Crossroads comprises several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. They look at international exchange programs and give tips on disaster preparedness.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: The Masterpieces Of Tsutaju
channel.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode takes a close look at artist Utamaro's iconic "Woman with a Glass Noisemaker.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Medical Frontiers
channel.desc: iPS cells are being used to treat eye diseases to address donor shortages. We explore advancements made in Japan, such as the transplantation of iPS cell-derived corneal cells and retinal sheets.

channel.desc: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.
